metadata.description: Reorganized tool definitions with PubMed research pipeline

tools.name: email_search
tools.description: Search and retrieve emails from Gmail with filtering capabilities

resource_dependencies.name: Gmail
resource_dependencies.description: Google Gmail email service for searching and retrieving emails

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Gmail search query (e.g., 'from:user@example.com', 'subject:meeting', 'after:2024/01/01'). Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Gmail folder/label to search in

parameters.name: date_range
parameters.description: Optional date range filter with 'start_date' and 'end_date' keys

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of emails to retrieve

emails.subject: Weekly AI Newsletter - Latest Developments
emails.body: This week in AI: Major breakthrough in transformer architecture...

emails.subject: AI Research Digest - December 2024
emails.body: Monthly compilation of the most important AI research papers...

sample_responses.error_message: Gmail API quota exceeded. Please try again later.

tools.name: web_search
tools.description: Search the web for real-time information about any topic. Returns URLs and snippets that can be used with web_retrieve to get full webpage content.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The search term to look up on the web. Be specific and include relevant keywords for better results.

parameters.name: num_results
parameters.description: Number of search results to return

parameters.name: date_range
parameters.description: Date range for search results ('day', 'week', 'month', 'year', 'all')

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Geographic region for search results (e.g., 'us', 'uk', 'global')

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language for search results (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr')

outputs.name: search_results
outputs.description: List of web search results with URLs that can be used with web_retrieve to get full webpage content

schema_definition.description: Search result objects with URLs for web_retrieve

search_results.title: Latest AI Research Breakthroughs in 2024
search_results.snippet: Comprehensive overview of the most significant AI research developments in 2024, including advances in large language models, computer vision, and robotics.

search_results.title: OpenAI GPT-4 Turbo: New Features and Capabilities
search_results.snippet: Detailed analysis of GPT-4 Turbo's new features, performance improvements, and real-world applications in various industries.

search_results.title: Machine Learning Trends and Predictions for 2024
search_results.snippet: Expert predictions and analysis of emerging machine learning trends, including automated ML, federated learning, and ethical AI considerations.

outputs.query: very specific nonexistent search term xyz123

metadata.message: No results found for the given search term

sample_responses.error_message: Web search API temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.

tools.name: web_retrieve
tools.description: Retrieve and extract full content from webpages. Designed to work with web_search results - takes URLs from search results and retrieves complete webpage content including text, metadata, and structure.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL(s) of the webpage(s) to retrieve and extract content from. Can be a single URL string or an array of URLs. Commonly used with URLs from web_search results.

schema_definition.description: Webpage URL(s) - often from web_search results

parameters.name: extract_text_only
parameters.description: Whether to extract only text content (true) or include HTML (false)

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds

parameters.name: user_agent
parameters.description: User agent string to use for the request

schema_definition.description: User agent string (default: standard browser user agent)

outputs.name: webpage
outputs.description: Full webpage content with complete text, metadata, and structure. Complements web_search by providing detailed content beyond just snippets.

schema_definition.description: Complete webpage objects with full content

outputs.name: status_code
outputs.description: HTTP status code from the request

webpage.title: Understanding Machine Learning Fundamentals
webpage.content: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. This comprehensive guide covers the fundamental concepts, algorithms, and applications of machine learning in today's technology landscape.
webpage.html:
Understanding Machine Learning Fundamentals

Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence...

metadata.author: Dr. Sarah Johnson
metadata.description: A comprehensive guide to machine learning fundamentals

webpage.title: Page Not Found
webpage.content: The requested page could not be found.
webpage.html:
404 Not Found

The requested page could not be found.

sample_responses.description: Processing multiple URLs from web_search results

webpage.title: Latest AI Research Breakthroughs
webpage.content: Recent advances in artificial intelligence research have led to breakthrough developments in natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics. This article covers the most significant discoveries of the past year.
webpage.html:
Latest AI Research Breakthroughs

Recent advances in artificial intelligence...

metadata.author: Dr. Emily Chen
metadata.description: Overview of recent AI research breakthroughs

webpage.title: Machine Learning Applications in Healthcare
webpage.content: Machine learning is revolutionizing healthcare through predictive analytics, diagnostic imaging, and personalized treatment plans. This comprehensive review examines current applications and future potential.
webpage.html:
Machine Learning Applications in Healthcare

Machine learning is revolutionizing healthcare...

tools.name: pubmed_search
tools.description: Search PubMed database using NCBI's E-utilities API to retrieve academic articles

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: PubMed search query using standard syntax (e.g., 'machine learning[Title/Abstract] AND 2024[PDAT]')

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: Maximum number of articles to return

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort results by: 'relevance', 'date', 'author', 'journal'

parameters.name: date_range
parameters.description: Filter by publication date range

parameters.name: article_types
parameters.description: Filter by article types (Clinical Trial, Review, Meta-Analysis, etc.)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Additional fields to retrieve beyond standard set

outputs.name: articles
outputs.description: Retrieved PubMed articles with full metadata

outputs.name: total_results
outputs.description: Total articles found (may exceed returned count)

outputs.name: search_metadata
outputs.description: Query performance and API response information

articles.title: Machine Learning Applications in Medical Diagnosis: A Comprehensive Review
articles.abstract: Recent advances in machine learning have transformed medical diagnosis...

sample_responses.error_message: PubMed API temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.

tools.name: extract
tools.description: Extract specific information from items using extraction functions. Works with single items or lists. Note: For detailed information extraction from web content, use web_retrieve first to get full content - search results only contain snippets.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Single item or list of items to process. For web content analysis, use webpage objects from web_retrieve rather than search_result objects (which only contain snippets).

schema_definition.description: Items to extract from - preferably full content objects

parameters.name: extraction_function
parameters.description: Function or prompt describing what to extract (e.g., 'extract sentiment and key topics')

parameters.name: extraction_fields
parameters.description: List of field names to extract (e.g., ['sentiment', 'topics', 'priority'])

parameters.name: batch_process
parameters.description: Whether to process as a batch (true) or individual items (false)

outputs.name: extractions
outputs.description: List of extraction results with item IDs and extracted data

sample_responses.error_message: Failed to extract data from malformed input

sample_responses.description: Extracting from search results with limited content

original_item.title: New AI Model Released
original_item.snippet: Company X announced their latest AI model...

extraction.title: New AI Model Released
extraction.implications: Cannot extract - need full content from web_retrieve

metadata.warning: Search results only contain snippets. Use web_retrieve for detailed extraction.
metadata.recommendation: Use web_retrieve first, then extract from webpage content

tools.name: summarize
tools.description: Create summaries of content based on specific summarization mandates

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to summarize (text, structured data, or mixed)

parameters.name: summarization_mandate
parameters.description: Instructions for how to summarize (e.g., 'Create executive summary focusing on key metrics and trends')

parameters.name: summary_type
parameters.description: Type of summary ('executive', 'detailed', 'bullet_points', 'narrative', 'statistical')

parameters.name: target_length
parameters.description: Target length ('brief', 'medium', 'comprehensive')

parameters.name: focus_areas
parameters.description: Specific areas to focus on

summary.title: Weekly Email Analysis Summary
summary.content: Analysis of 127 emails over the past week reveals increasing engagement with AI-related topics. Average sentiment remains positive at 0.72, with notable spikes in discussions around machine learning applications and research developments.
key_points: AI and ML topics dominating discussions
recommendations: Continue focus on AI research content
Consider increasing frequency of ML application updates

tools.name: pubmed_generate_query
tools.description: Generate optimized PubMed search queries using LLM assistance based on research goals and requirements

parameters.name: research_goal
parameters.description: High-level description of research objective (e.g., 'Find recent studies on machine learning applications in medical diagnosis')

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Research domain for context: 'medical', 'technology', 'biology', 'psychology', 'general'

parameters.name: time_frame
parameters.description: Desired publication timeframe: 'last_year', 'last_5_years', 'last_10_years', 'all_time'

parameters.name: study_types
parameters.description: Preferred study types: Clinical Trial, Review, Meta-Analysis, Case Study, Observational Study

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Required keywords to include in search

parameters.name: exclude_terms
parameters.description: Terms to exclude from search results

parameters.name: max_queries
parameters.description: Number of alternative queries to generate

parameters.name: query_strategy
parameters.description: Query generation approach: 'comprehensive', 'focused', 'exploratory'

outputs.name: generated_queries
outputs.description: Generated PubMed query options with rationale and metadata

generated_queries.query_string: ("machine learning"[Title/Abstract] OR "artificial intelligence"[Title/Abstract]) AND ("medical diagnosis"[Title/Abstract] OR "diagnostic imaging"[MeSH Terms]) AND 2020:2024[PDAT]
generated_queries.rationale: Comprehensive search combining ML/AI terms with medical diagnosis, focused on recent publications
Focused on deep learning in radiology/pathology diagnosis with very recent papers
Simple search for recent diabetes research using MeSH terms

sample_responses.error_message: Unable to generate meaningful queries from the provided research goal. Please provide more specific information.

tools.name: pubmed_extract_features
tools.description: Extract structured information from PubMed abstracts using LLM processing with configurable extraction schemas

parameters.name: articles
parameters.description: PubMed articles to process from search results

parameters.name: extraction_schema
parameters.description: JSON schema defining fields to extract (e.g., {'methodology': 'string', 'sample_size': 'number'})

parameters.name: extraction_instructions
parameters.description: Detailed prompt for LLM extraction with field definitions and formatting requirements

parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.description: Number of articles to process per LLM call

parameters.name: validation_mode
parameters.description: How to handle extraction errors: 'strict', 'partial', 'best_effort'

outputs.name: extractions
outputs.description: Extraction results with original articles and extracted features

original_article.title: Machine Learning Applications in Medical Diagnosis
original_article.abstract: Recent advances in machine learning have transformed medical diagnosis...

original_article.title: Brief Note on AI in Healthcare

sample_responses.error_message: LLM service unavailable. Unable to process extraction requests.

tools.name: group_reduce
tools.description: Group objects by rules and apply reduce functions to create aggregated results

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: List of objects to group

parameters.name: key_func
parameters.description: Function to extract grouping key from each item (e.g., 'date(timestamp)', 'sender', 'category')

parameters.name: reduce_func
parameters.description: Function to aggregate items in each group (e.g., 'count', 'sum', 'average')

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Field to sort results by

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Sort direction ('asc' or 'desc')

parameters.name: include_items
parameters.description: Whether to include original items in results

group_key.description: String representation of the group key

items.description: Original items in the group (if include_items=true)

tools.name: pubmed_score_articles
tools.description: Score articles based on extracted features using configurable scoring functions and criteria

parameters.name: articles_with_features
parameters.description: Articles with extracted features from extraction tool

parameters.name: scoring_criteria
parameters.description: Scoring configuration with weights and functions

scoring_functions.description: How to score each feature type

parameters.name: score_function
parameters.description: Overall scoring algorithm: 'weighted_sum', 'composite', 'ml_model'

parameters.name: include_percentiles
parameters.description: Whether to calculate percentile rankings

outputs.name: scored_articles
outputs.description: Articles with calculated scores and breakdowns

score_distribution.description: Min, max, mean, std dev of scores

original_article.title: Machine Learning Applications in Medical Diagnosis

tools.name: pubmed_filter_rank
tools.description: Filter and rank scored articles based on thresholds and additional criteria to produce final result set

parameters.name: scored_articles
parameters.description: Articles with calculated scores from scoring tool

schema_definition.description: Scored articles to filter and rank

parameters.name: min_score_threshold
parameters.description: Minimum score to include in results (0.0-1.0)

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: Maximum number of articles to return

parameters.name: ranking_criteria
parameters.description: Additional ranking factors beyond scores

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Additional filter criteria

parameters.name: output_format
parameters.description: Level of detail in results: 'summary', 'detailed', 'analysis_ready'

original_article.title: Machine Learning Applications in Medical Diagnosis

metadata.warning: All articles filtered out. Consider relaxing filter criteria.
